author: abhi18av
body:
Steps to reproduce
------------------

```
open Powershell 6 from start menu
```

Expected behavior
-----------------

```powershell
PowerShell 6.1.0
Copyright (c) Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.

https://aka.ms/pscore6-docs
Type 'help' to get help.

PS C:\Users\abhi1>

```

Actual behavior
---------------

```powershell
PowerShell 6.1.0
Copyright (c) Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.

https://aka.ms/pscore6-docs
Type 'help' to get help.

D:\.vagrant.dD:\.vagrant.d
PS C:\Users\abhi1>

```

Environment data
----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```powershell
PS C:\Users\abhi1> $PSVersionTable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.1.0
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    6.1.0
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.17134
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0


```

comments.author: kvprasoon
comments.body: @abhi18av Are you using $Profile script ? better to check if it is throwing from it.

comments.author: abhi18av
comments.body:
Perhaps yes, I needed to update the `VAGRANT_HOME` environment variable and only after that this started happening. 

Could you please guide me how can I make it better ?

comments.author: kvprasoon
comments.body:
How are you setting the env var ? 

I would suggest to do it like below
`Set-Item -Path Env:\VAGRANT_HOME -Value 'your path'` or just `$env:VAGRANT_HOME='your path'`

comments.author: abhi18av
comments.body:
@kvprasoon , thanks for the revert.

I tried using that but doesn't seem to work.

Here's how I set the environment variable 

```
 Set-Item -Path Env:\VAGRANT_HOME -Value "D:\.vagrant.d"
```

comments.author: abhi18av
comments.body:
This suggestion here, resolved my issue 👍 

https://github.com/lukesampson/pshazz/issues/73

title: Powershell-core prints env variables at startup.
